summary: Harriet Tubman worked to free her people as a young slave. She ran away to the North but returned to the South to help other slaves escape. She became a leader of the Underground Railroad, a secret network providing food and shelter to runaway slaves. She led groups of slaves on the perilous journey north, traveling at night and hiding during the day. Her daring rescues helped hundreds of slaves escape to freedom.
quotes: at one time a &+r but at a time reward over forty thousand &-uh dollars was offered for her capture
